metadata.title: CVE-2024-40924 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/i915/dpt: Make DPT object unshrinkableIn some scenarios, the DPT object gets shrunk butthe actual framebuffer did not and thus its stillthere on the DPT's vm->bound_list. Then it tries torewrite the PTEs via a stale CPU mapping. This causes panic.[vsyrjala: Add TODO comment](cherry picked from commit 51064d471c53dcc8eddd2333c3f1c1d9131ba36c)
